relationships.description: Discussing potential employment opportunity at Hogan Lovells
Colleagues at Hogan Lovells, Immelt recommending Davison to Ruemmler
Ruemmler forwarding email correspondence to Jeffrey

analysis.purpose: To forward a job opportunity discussion to Jeffrey and express interest in a position at Hogan Lovells while seeking compensation details
analysis.significance: Shows professional networking and job consideration between legal professionals, with political commentary on 2016 presidential race

notable_quotes: I am still intrigued and would like to meet Michael. I thinks it makes sense, though, for us to have a more specific conversation about compensation before I meet with him.

I don't want to put the cart before the horse, but as I mentioned, this would be a big move for me, and it would have to make sense economically in addition to being the right move for other reasons we have discussed.
Cannot believe that Christie endorsed Trump!

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present - appears to be standard professional communication about employment opportunities

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is legitimate professional correspondence about employment considerations

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be private professional correspondence about employment opportunities, not previously public information

analysis.summary: Kathy Ruemmler forwards an email exchange with Stephen Immelt of Hogan Lovells regarding a potential job opportunity, expressing interest in meeting Michael Davison but wanting to discuss compensation specifics first, while also commenting on Chris Christie's endorsement of Donald Trump in the 2016 presidential race.
